<line: 29> which was accepted by the court.
<line: 30>  was found guilty on count(s)
<line: 31> after a plea of not guilty.

[TEXT]
<line: 57> It is ordered that the defendant must notify the United States attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of name, residence,
<line: 58> or mailing address until all fines, restitution,.
<line: 59> , and special assessments imposed by this judgment are fully paid. If ordered to pay restitution,.
<line: 60> the defendant must notify the court and United States attorney of material changes in economic circumstances..

[TITLE]
<line: 8> IMPRISONMENT

[TEXT]
<line: 10> The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the Federal Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total
<line: 11> term of:

[TEXT]
<line: 13> Six (6) months.

[TEXT]
<line: 15>  The court makes the following recommendations to the Bureau of Prisons:

[TEXT]
<line: 17> The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal..

[TEXT]
<line: 19>  The defendant shall surrender to the United States Marshal for this district:.

[TEXT]
<line: 21>  at
<line: 22>  a.m.
<line: 23>  p.m.
<line: 24>  on
<line: 25>  as notified by the United States Marshal.

[TEXT]
<line: 27>  The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons:.

[TEXT]
<line: 29>  before 2 p.m. on
<line: 30>  as notified by the United States Marshal..
<line: 31>  as notified by the Probation or Pretrial Services Office..

<line: 3> Sheet 3 — Supervised Release 

[ABANDON]
<line: 5> Judgment—Page 

[TITLE]
<line: 7> DEFENDANT: 
<line: 8> Jose Luis RODRIGUEZ-NUÑEZ

[TITLE]
<line: 10> SUPERVISED RELEASE 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> Upon release from imprisonment, you will be on supervised release for a term of : 
<line: 13> One (1) year.

[TITLE]
<line: 15> UNDER THE FOLLOWING TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

[TITLE]
<line: 17> MANDATORY CONDITIONS 

[TEXT]
<line: 19> 1.  
<line: 20> You must not commit another federal, state or local crime.

[TEXT]
<line: 22> 2.  
<line: 23> You must not unlawfully possess a controlled substance.

[TEXT]
<line: 25> 3.  
<line: 26> You must refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled substance. You must submit to one drug test within 15 days of release from
<line: 27> imprisonment and at least two periodic drug tests thereafter, as determined by the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 29> G The above drug testing condition is suspended, based on the court's determination that you  
<line: 30> pose a low risk of future substance abuse. (check if applicable)  

[TEXT]
<line: 32> 4.
<line: 33> You must cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer. (check if applicable) 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 5.
<line: 36> You must comply with the requirements of the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (42 U.S.C. § 16901, et seq.) as
<line: 37> directed by the probation officer, the Bureau of Prisons, or any state sex offender registration agency in WKHORFDWLRQwhHUH you
<line: 38> reside, work,are a student, or were convicted of a qualifying offense. (check if applicable) 
<line: 39> 6.
<line: 40> You must participate in an approved program for domestic violence. (check if applicable) 

[TEXT]
<line: 42> You must comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this court as well as with any other conditions on the attached 
<line: 43> page. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> AO 245B (Rev. 11/16)  
<line: 3> Judgment in a Criminal Case 
<line: 4> Sheet 3A — Supervised Release 

[TITLE]
<line: 6> DEFENDANT: 
<line: 7> CASE NUMBER: 
<line: 8> Jose Luis RODRIGUEZ-NUÑEZ
<line: 9> 3:17-CR-080-01 (PG)

[TITLE]
<line: 11> STANDARD CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION 

[TEXT]
<line: 13> As part of your supervised release, you must comply with the following standard conditions of supervision.  These conditions are imposed
<line: 14> because they establish the basic expectations for your behavior while on supervision and identify the minimum tools needed by probation
<line: 15> officers to keep informed, report to the court about, and bring about improvements in your conduct and condition. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 1.  
<line: 18> You must report to the probation office in the federal judicial district where you are authorized to reside within 72 hours of your
<line: 19> release from imprisonment, unless the probation officer instructs you to report to a different probation office or within a different time
<line: 20> frame.
<line: 21> 2.  
<line: 22> After initially reporting to the probation office, you will receive instructions from the court or the probation officer about how and
<line: 23> when you must report to the probation officer, and you must report to the probation officer as instructed.
<line: 24> 3.  
<line: 25> You must not knowingly leave the federal judicial district where you are authorized to reside without first getting permission from the
<line: 26> court or the probation officer.
<line: 27> 4.  
<line: 28> You must answer truthfully the questions asked by your probation officer.
<line: 29> 5.  
<line: 30> You must live at a place approved by the probation officer. If you plan to change where you live or anything about your living
<line: 31> arrangements (such as the people you live with), you must notify the probation officer at least 10 days before the change. If notifying
<line: 32> the probation officer in advance is not possible due to unanticipated circumstances, you must notify the probation officer within 72
<line: 33> hours of becoming aware of a change or expected change.
<line: 34> 6.  
<line: 35> You must allow the probation officer to visit you at any time at your home or elsewhere, and you must permit the probation officer to
<line: 36> take any items prohibited by the conditions of your supervision that he or she observes in plain view.
<line: 37> 7.  
<line: 38> You must work full time (at least 30 hours per week) at a lawful type of employment, unless the probation officer excuses you from
<line: 39> doing so.  If you do not have full-time employment you must try to find full-time employment, unless the probation officer excuses
<line: 40> you from doing so. If you plan to change where you work or anything about your work (such as your position or your job
<line: 41> responsibilities), you must notify the probation officer at least 10 days before the change. If notifying the probation officer at least 10
<line: 42> days in advance is not possible due to unanticipated circumstances, you must notify the probation officer within 72 hours of
<line: 43> becoming aware of a change or expected change.
<line: 44> 8.  
<line: 45> You must not communicate or interact with someone you know is engaged in criminal activity.  If you know someone has been
<line: 46> convicted of a felony, you must not knowingly communicate or interact with that person without first getting the permission of the
<line: 47> probation officer.
<line: 48> 9.  
<line: 49> If you are arrested or questioned by a law enforcement officer, you must notify the probation officer within 72 hours.
<line: 50> 10.  You must not own, possess, or have access to a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or dangerous weapon (i.e., anything that was
<line: 51> designed, or was modified for, the specific purpose of causing bodily injury or death to another person such as nunchakus or tasers).
<line: 52> 11.  You must not act or make any agreement with a law enforcement agency to act as a confidential human source or informant without
<line: 53> first getting the permission of the court.
<line: 54> 12.  If the probation officer determines that you pose a risk to another person (including an organization), the probation officer may
<line: 55> require you to notify the person about the risk and you must comply with that instruction.  The probation officer may contact the
<line: 56> person and confirm that you have notified the person about the risk.
<line: 57> 13.  You must follow the instructions of the probation officer related to the conditions of supervision.

[TITLE]
<line: 59> U.S. Probation Office Use Only 

[TEXT]
<line: 61> A U.S. probation officer has instructed me on the conditions specified by the court and has provided me with a written copy of this
<line: 62> judgment containing these conditions. For further information regarding these conditions, see Overview of Probation and Supervised 
<line: 63> Release Conditions, available at: www.uscourts.gov. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 65> Defendant's Signature 

[ABANDON]
<line: 67> Date 

[ABANDON]

<line: 3> Judgment in a Criminal Case 
<line: 4> Sheet 3D — Supervised Release 

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> Judgment—Page 

[ABANDON]
<line: 8> of 

[TEXT]
<line: 10> DEFENDANT: 
<line: 11> CASE NUMBER: 
<line: 12> Jose Luis RODRIGUEZ-NUÑEZ
<line: 13> 3:17-CR-080-01 (PG)

[TITLE]
<line: 15> SPECIAL CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 1. The defendant shall cooperate in the collection of a DNA sample as directed by the Probation Officer, pursuant to the
<line: 18> Revised DNA Collection Requirements, and Title 18, U.S. Code Section 3563(a)(9).

[TEXT]
<line: 20> 2. If deported or granted voluntary departure, the defendant shall remain outside the United States and all places subject
<line: 21> to its jurisdiction unless prior written permission to reenter is obtained from the pertinent legal authorities and the defendant
<line: 22> notifies in writing the Probation Officer of this Court to that effect.

[ABANDON]

<line: 4>  Criminal Monetary Penalties

[TITLE]
<line: 6> DEFENDANT: Jose Luis RODRIGUEZ-NUNEZ
<line: 7> CASE NUMBER: 3:17-CR-080-01 (PG)

[TITLE]
<line: 9> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 11> The defendant must pay the total criminal monetary penalties under the schedule of payments on Sheet 6.

[TABLE]
<line: 13> JVTA Assessment*
<line: 14> Fine
<line: 15> Assessment
<line: 16> Restitution
<line: 17> TOTALS
<line: 18> $ 100.00
<line: 19> $ 0.00
<line: 20> $ 0.00
<line: 21> $ 0.00

[TEXT]
<line: 23>  The determination of restitution is deferred until.
<line: 24> . An Amended Judgment in a Criminal Case (AO 245C) will be entered
<line: 25> after such determination.

[TEXT]
<line: 27>  The defendant must make restitution (including community restitution) to the following payees in the amount listed below.

[TEXT]
<line: 29> If the defendant makes a partial payment, each payee shall receive an approximately proportioned payment, unless specified otherwise in
<line: 30> the priority order or percentage payment column below. However, pursuant to 18'U.s.C. s 3664(i), all nonfederal victims must be paid
<line: 31> before the United States is paid.

[TABLE]
<line: 33> Name of Payee
<line: 34> Total Loss**
<line: 35> Restitution Ordered
<line: 36> Priority or Percentage
<line: 37> TOTALS
<line: 38> $

[TEXT]
<line: 40>  Restitution amount ordered pursuant to plea agreement $

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 43>  The defendant must pay interest on restitution and a fine of more than $2,500, unless the restitution or fine is paid in full before the
<line: 44> fifteenth day after the date of the judgment, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.  3612(f). All of the payment options on Sheet 6 may be subject
<line: 45> to penalties for delinquency and default, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. s 3612(g).

[TEXT]
<line: 47>  The court determined that the defendant does not have the ability to pay interest and it is ordered that:

[TEXT]
<line: 49> the interest requirement is waived for the
<line: 50> fine restitution
<line: 51> the interest requirement for the
<line: 52>   fine  restitution is modified as follows:

[TEXT]

<line: 55> after September 13, 1994, but before April 23, 1996..

<line: 4> Sheet 6 -- Schedule of Payments

<line: 6> of 7

[TITLE]
<line: 10> DEFENDANT: Jose Luis RODRIGUEZ-NUNEZ
<line: 11> CASE NUMBER: 3:17-CR-080-01 (PG)

[TITLE]
<line: 13> SCHEDULE OF PAYMENTS

[TEXT]
<line: 15> Having assessed the defendant's ability to pay, payment of the total criminal monetary penalties is due as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 17> A
<line: 18> Lump sum payment of $
<line: 19> 100.00
<line: 20> due immediately, balance due
<line: 21>  not later than
<line: 22> , or
<line: 23> in accordance with  C,
<line: 24>  D,
<line: 25>  E, or
<line: 26>  F below; or
<line: 27> B
<line: 28>  Payment to begin immediately (may be combined with
<line: 29> c,
<line: 30>  D, or
<line: 31>  F below); or
<line: 32> C
<line: 33>  Payment in equal
<line: 34> (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of $
<line: 35> over a period of
<line: 36> (e.g., months or years), to commence.
<line: 37> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after the date of this judgment; or
<line: 38> D
<line: 39> Payment in equal
<line: 40> (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of $
<line: 41> over a period of
<line: 42> (e.g., months or years), to commence.
<line: 43> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from imprisonment to a
<line: 44> term of supervision; or
<line: 45> E
<line: 46> Payment during the term of supervised release will commence within.
<line: 47> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from.
<line: 48> imprisonment. The court will set the payment plan based on an assessment of the defendant's ability to pay at that time; or
<line: 49> F
<line: 50> Special instructions regarding the payment of criminal monetary penalties:.

[TEXT]
<line: 52> Unless the court has expressly ordered otherwise, if this judgment imposes imprisonment, payment of criminal monetary penalties is due during
<line: 53> the period of imprisonment.' All criminal monetary,penalties, except those payments made through the Federal Bureau of Prisons' Inmate
<line: 54> Financial Responsibility Program, are made to the clerk of the court..

[TEXT]
<line: 56> The defendant shall receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed.

[TEXT]
<line: 58>  Joint and Several

[TEXT]
<line: 60> Defendant and Co-Defendant Names and Case Numbers (including defendant number), Total Amount, Joint and Several Amount,
<line: 61> and corresponding payee, if appropriate..

[TEXT]
<line: 63> The defendant shall pay the cost of prosecution..
<line: 64> The defendant shall pay the following court cost(s):
<line: 65> The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States:

[TEXT]
<line: 67> Payments shall be applied in the following order: (1) assessment, (2) restitution principal, (3) restitution interest, (4) fine principal, (5) fine
<line: 68> interest, (6) community restitution, (7) JVTA assessment, (8) penalties, and (9) costs, including cost of prosecution and court costs.
